sen.j: 義天玄詔（ぎてんげんしょう、明徳4年（1393年） － 寛正3年3月18日 (旧暦)（1462年4月17日））は、室町時代中期の臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Giten Gensho (1393-April 17, 1462) was a priest of the Rinzai Sect of Buddhism in the middle of the Muromachi period.

sen.e: At the age of 18, he became a priest studying under Meion GIZAN, and trained himself in Buddhist ascetic practices at the Kennin-ji Temple in Kyoto and the Zuisen-ji Temple at Inuyama, Owari Province.

sen.e: After that he practiced Zen meditation in various temples, and in 1450 established the Ryoan-ji Temple in Mt. Kinugasa in Kyoto, and then moved to the Daitoku-ji Temple in 1453.
